005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.object;
007
008import java.time.OffsetTime;
009import java.util.Objects;
010
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
012
013/**
014 * Represents a date value which may not have a timezone making it ambiguous as
015 * a window in time.
016 */
017public class AmbiguousTime
018    extends AbstractAmbiguousTemporal<AmbiguousTime, OffsetTime> {
019
020  /**
021   * Construct a new date object. This type supports ambiguous dates that were
022   * provided without a time zone.
023   * <p>
024   * The date value will be ambiguous if the {@code hasTimeZone} is {@code false}.
025   *
026   * @param value
027   *          the date value
028   * @param hasTimeZone
029   *          {@code true} if the date is intended to have an associated time zone
030   *          or {@code false} otherwise
031   */
032  public AmbiguousTime(@NonNull OffsetTime value, boolean hasTimeZone) {
033    super(value, hasTimeZone);
034  }
035
036  @Override
037  public AmbiguousTime copy() {
038    return new AmbiguousTime(getValue(), hasTimeZone());
039  }
040
041  @Override
042  public int hashCode() {
043    return Objects.hash(getValue(), hasTimeZone());
044  }
045
046  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.OnlyOneReturn")
047  @Override
048  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
049    if (this == obj) {
050      return true;
051    }
052    if (!(obj instanceof AmbiguousTime)) {
053      return false;
054    }
055    AmbiguousTime other = (AmbiguousTime) obj;
056    return hasTimeZone() == other.hasTimeZone() && getValue().equals(other.getValue());
057  }
058}
